com.flowpowered.react.collision.narrowphase.EPA

Class EPAAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.react.collision.narrowphase.EPA.EPAAlgorithm

  • public class EPAAlgorithm
extends Object
    This class is the implementation of the Expanding Polytope Algorithm (EPA). The EPA algorithm computes the penetration depth and contact points between two enlarged objects (with margin) where the original objects (without margin) intersect. The penetration depth of a pair of intersecting objects A and B is the length of a point on the boundary of the Minkowski sum (A-B) closest to the origin. The goal of the EPA algorithm is to start with an initial simplex polytope that contains the origin and expend it in order to find the point on the boundary of (A-B) that is closest to the origin. An initial simplex that contains the origin has been computed with the GJK algorithm. The EPA Algorithm will extend this simplex polytope to find the correct penetration depth. The implementation of the EPA algorithm is based on the book "Collision Detection in 3D Environments".

    • Method Detail

      • computePenetrationDepthAndContactPoints

        public boolean computePenetrationDepthAndContactPoints(Simplex simplex,
                                                       CollisionShape collisionShape1,
                                                       Transform transform1,
                                                       CollisionShape collisionShape2,
                                                       Transform transform2,
                                                       Vector3 v,
                                                       ContactPoint.ContactPointInfo contactInfo)
        Computes the penetration depth with the EPA algorithm. This method computes the penetration depth and contact points between two enlarged objects (with margin) where the original objects (without margin) intersect. An initial simplex that contains the origin has been computed with GJK algorithm. The EPA Algorithm will extend this simplex polytope to find the correct penetration depth. Returns true if the computation was successful, false if not.
        Parameters:
        simplex - The initial simplex
        collisionShape1 - The first collision shape
        transform1 - The transform of the first collision shape
        collisionShape2 - The second collision shape
        transform2 - The transform of the second collision shape
        v - The vector in which to store the closest point
        contactInfo - The contact info in which to store the contact info of the collision
        Returns:
        Whether or not the computation was successful
